alertDefProperties.name: RUM - High Largest Contentful Paint (LCP)
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert monitors elevated Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) times reported through Real User Monitoring (RUM) data. High LCP values suggest delays in rendering the largest visible content element, which directly impacts the user's perception of page load speed.

The alert is triggered when the average LCP exceeds a defined threshold (e.g., 2.5 seconds) over a specified monitoring period (e.g., 10 minutes).

Monitoring this metric helps ensure that the most meaningful content loads quickly, contributing to a smooth and engaging user experience and supporting Core Web Vitals compliance.

Customization Guidance:
  - Threshold: Set the LCP threshold based on web performance benchmarks (ideally under 2.5 seconds for good user experience).
  - Monitoring Period: Align the monitoring window with your site's traffic trends to detect and respond to performance regressions effectively.
  - Notification Frequency: Configure to alert only on sustained high values or recurring issues to avoid unnecessary noise.

Action: If this alert is triggered, analyze the LCP elements affected, review image and video optimization strategies, minimize server response times, and streamline render paths to improve loading performance.
